Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial on Preoperative Advance Care Planning in Older Adults Undergoing Major Surgery

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants were randomised to receive a question prompt list brochure with 11 questions or usual care.

Participants.evidence: Participants included surgeons performing high-risk surgeries and patients aged 60 or older with at least one comorbidity and an oncological or vascular problem.

Intervention.evidence: Patients were randomised to receive a question prompt list brochure with 11 questions or usual care.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the frequency of ACP discussions and documentation, measured during audiorecorded preoperative consultations from June 1, 2016, to November 30, 2018.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 213 patients were randomised: 107 to the intervention and 106 to the control group.

Result_Outcome.evidence: No significant differences were found in ACP discussions or AD documentation between the intervention (38 [35%]) and control groups (34 [33%]; P = .77).
